head.supplied: ¶ [Submitting a/cs for labor of boys in Botanical Gardens £61.1.0 £76.17.0 & £77.5.0] ¶ This letter was referred back to Mon7 December 1871 minuted'C. S. considers charge extravagant',andwas returned...

div.p: No. 14329, vol. 1871 Z, VPRS 1168/P inward correspondence registers, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Letter not found; item is a register entry only, of an item dated 10 November 1871.
[Submitting a/cs for labor of boys in Botanical Gardens £61.1.0 £76.17.0 & £77.5.0]
This letter was referred back to Mon7 December 1871 minuted'C. S. considers charge extravagant',andwas returnedon13 December.
M had previously questioned an invoice for £77.5.0 received from the Department of Industrial and Reformatory Schools in M to G. Duncan,19 August 1871 (in this edition as 71-08-29a), pointing out that he had no funds to pay it. M to C. Duffy, 5 October 1871, and notes thereto indicate that a method of accounting for the labour had been agreed, and reported in W. Odgers to M, 23 October 1871. That agreement appears not to have been followed precisely, as M was expected to return checked invoices to the Inspector of Industrial Schools, not direct to the Chief Secretary's department.
